question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration purposes. Display all videos from a video folder on a web page without using a server.

checklist.title: Is the local file access implementation correctly designed?
checklist.description: Check if the code properly implements file access using the HTML5 File API or other client-side techniques. Score 0 if no solution for local file access is provided, 5 if a basic implementation with limitations is present, and 10 if a robust solution with proper error handling is implemented that works across modern browsers.

checklist.title: Are appropriate video formats and codecs supported?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code handles multiple video formats (MP4, WebM, OGG) and provides fallbacks for browser compatibility. Deduct 3 points if only one format is supported without fallbacks, 5 points if common formats are missing. Check if the implementation detects and handles unsupported formats gracefully. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is a functional video playback interface implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the implementation includes essential playback controls (play/pause, volume, seek bar, fullscreen toggle). Deduct 2 points for each missing core control. Also check if the player includes nice-to-have features like playback speed controls or picture-in-picture support. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is there an effective video gallery navigation system?
checklist.description: Assess whether the implementation provides a gallery-style interface for browsing and selecting videos (thumbnails, filtering, sorting options). Score 3 points for basic listing, 7 points for intermediate features like thumbnails and sorting, and 10 points for advanced gallery features with responsive design and good organization.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as unsupported file formats, large video files, corrupted videos, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Automatic thumbnail generation 2. Video metadata extraction and display 3. Playlist creation functionality). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple video player instances) 2. Function modules unrelated to video playback (e.g., unnecessary data processing) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating UI/video processing/file handling), maintainability, and code organization. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if there's no separation of concerns. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
